fields_of_interest: Foreign and Security Policy and Defence
eu_initiatives: Clearly much of the focus of the Institute revolves around core national security issues which are the responsibility of the Member States and NATO. However, the Institute takes a broad view of what counts as security, and also follows not just CFSP, but also economic and home security issues where also EU policy issues are engaged from energy and climate change, to immigration and cybersecurity.
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
goals__remit: The Institute seeks to contribute to the transformation of national and international institutions, corporate, private and public bodies, so that these can remain effective tools of statecraft in the face of today's rapid and profound global change. By improving exchanges between government, academia and the private sector, The Institute seeks to promote a better understanding of how to advance the national interest and enhance national security.
relevant_communication:
Participation in EP hearings.    
Over the last year the Institute’s principal policy implementation is by seminars and publications.
